intro: Cybianthus perseoides, commonly known as the goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has silvery-green foliage with a dense, bushy growth habit. Cybianthus perseoides is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
